thread.title: PREVIEW: Snow White, Theatre Royal, Winchester
thread.title_full: PREVIEW: Snow White, Theatre Royal, Winchester

title: PREVIEW: Snow White, Theatre Royal, Winchester
text:
0 comments 
SNOW White is the second of balletLORENT's trilogy of fairytale adaptations written by Poet Laureate Carol Ann Duffy. 
Their mystical adaptation of this classic Brothers Grimm fairytale, co-produced by Northern Stage and commissioned by Sadler's Wells, comes to Theatre Royal Winchester next week. 
Snow White re-imagines the well-loved story of a mother's poisonous jealousy, exploring thwarted desire, deception, compassion and redemption with magical mirrors, mysterious miners and beauty as pure as feathered snow. 
Snow White is the second chapter of a trilogy of Brothers Grimm fairytales created by balletLORENT, which began with the highly acclaimed Rapunzel. Share article 
See it on Tuesday and Wednesday when ten local children join the 11 strong professional cast. 
Visit theatreroyalwinchester.co.uk or call 01962 840440. Promoted Stories PREVIEW: Snow White, Theatre Royal, Winchester Sorry, an error occurred.
